meanings.definition: To baptize in the Christian faith.
meanings.sent1: The priest will christen the baby during the church ceremony.
meanings.sent2: They decided to christen their newborn with a traditional baptism.
meanings.sent3: The baby giggled as the priest tried to christen him with holy water.
meanings.sent4: The rain seemed to christen the earth with a gentle touch.
meanings.sent5: The act of christening symbolizes a new beginning in the Christian faith.

meanings.definition: To name or dedicate (a ship, building, etc.) formally.
meanings.sent1: They will christen the new ship with a bottle of champagne.
meanings.sent2: The mayor will christen the new library in a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully tried to christen their treehouse with a special name.
meanings.sent4: The artist will christen his latest masterpiece at the gallery opening.
meanings.sent5: The plaque on the building will christen it as a historical landmark.
